official-title-amendment.#text: Amend the title so as to read:

official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to
		  require courses of education provided by public institutions of higher
		  education that are approved for purposes of the educational assistance programs
		  administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to charge veterans tuition
		  and fees at the in-State tuition rate.

short-title.#text:
GI Bill Tuition Fairness Act of
			 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited
			 as the

The table of
			 contents for this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text:
Sec. 1. Short title; table of
				contents.

Sec. 2. References to title 38, United States
				Code.

Sec. 3. Approval of courses of education
				provided by public educational institutions for purposes of educational
				assistance programs administered by Secretary of Veterans Affairs conditional
				on in-State tuition rate for veterans.

Sec. 4. Extension of authorization of
				appropriations for payment of a monthly assistance allowance to disabled
				veterans training or competing for the Paralympic Team.

Sec. 5. Extension of authorization of
				appropriations for assistance to United States Paralympics, Inc.

Sec. 6. Clarification of eligibility for
				services under the Homeless Veterans Reintegration Program.

Sec. 7. Extension of eligibility period for
				vocational rehabilitation programs.

Sec. 9. Responsibilities of the Directors of
				Veterans’ Employment and Training.

Sec. 10. Contents of Transition Assistance
				Program.

Sec. 11. Three-month extension of Veterans
				Retraining Assistance Program.

Sec. 12. Increase in rates of disability
				compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation.

Sec. 13. Performance awards in the senior
				executive service.

Responsibilities of
			 the Directors of Veterans’ Employment and Training

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out the following responsibilities:

text.#text: Each Director assigned to a State under

Monitoring the performance of veterans’
				training and employment programs in the State, with special emphasis on
				services to disabled veterans.

Monitoring the
				performance of the State workforce agency in complying with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
corrective actions that could be
				taken by the State workforce agency to address deficiencies in the performance
				of veterans’ training and employment programs in the State.

Assistant Secretary of
				Labor for Veterans’ Employment and Training

				the State workforce agency to establish performance goals for veterans’
				training and employment programs in the State.
